_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The following subsections outline the requirements of the EPA's 40 CFR Part 68.155.

1.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Action Policies

The top priority of LBA/3771 Channel Dr is to provide a healthy and safe work environment for its facilities occupants and the surrounding community. In this effort, LBA/3771 Channel Dr has developed strict policies and procedures to reduce the risk of an accidental hazardous chemical release. The Process Safety Management (PSM) program acts as a gatekeeper of these policies and procedures.



The requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) PSM Standard CFR 1910.119 mirrors that of Risk Management Prevention Program 3 and therefore has been integrated. Of the 14 PSM elements, 13 focus on accidental release prevention and one on emergency planning and response. It is the commitment of management and employees to follow the established procedures and seek new ways for improvement.



2.    Stationary Source and Regulated Substance 

LBA/3771 Channel Dr is a freezing and storage facility located in Yolo County, the city of West Sacramento, California. This facility has one refrigeration system using Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS #7664-41-7) as the refrigerant. The total ammonia inventory meet/exceed the Federal threshold quantity and exceeds the threshold quantity of the State regulations for accidental release prevention.



3.    Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

EPA's Risk Management Prevention Program 3, 40 CFR Part 68(D) and OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 outline the facilities accidental release prevention program below. The facility has committed to completing audits and inspections as well as holding employee meetings to establish current procedures, ensure there is employee buy in for procedures and seek new opportunities for improvement to health and safety policies.



? Process Safety Information

? Process

Hazard Analysis

? Operating Procedures

? Training 

? Mechanical Integrity

? Incident Investigation 

? Pre-Startup Safety Review

? Management of Change 

? Contractors 

? Hot Work Permit 

? Compliance Audit 

? Employee Participation 

? Emergency Planning and Response





4.    Five-Year Accident History

A review into the accident history of the facility revealed that there have been no reportable releases of ammonia over the past five years.



5.    Emergency Response Program

LBA/3771 Channel Dr is using West Sacramento Fire Department as the first responder to an incident in the event of an uncontrolled release. LBA/3771 Channel Dr has developed Emergency Response plan to ensure an efficient response in the event of an accidental hazardous substance release, fire, explosion or any other emergency. The plan includes First Aid procedures and Emergency Medical Treatment procedures, Evacuation plans, Notification/Communication.



6.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

LBA/3771 Channel Dr is proactive in their approach to health and safety of its facility occupants and surrounding community. Any areas of improvement that can be identified in audits, hazard reviews and inspections are identified, and corrective actions are taken in the event a recommendation is made promptly.
